card.desc:
Don't use email as a communication tool. That's old school and not useful for group communication. 

**Invite only the necessary people** if someone is missing add them rather later than from the beginning. There is a history they can scroll through to get them updated.

## Tool

Use a modern communication tool like **Slack**,  **Discord**, **MS Teams** ...

## Channels

- use an **internal channel** to discuss stuff which is not necessary that the clients know. Otherwise the client will lose interest in reading messages in the channel. 
- create a **shared channel** for client and your internal team.

## Consider

- We all have a lot of tools an a lot of channels. Agree on a naming. Rename the channel if necessary. 
- Maybe to find a name for the channel is the first good thing as a group discussion.
- Use the features the tool of choice provides. E.g. in `Slack` use `Threads` to reply instead of writing in the channel in top level. This hold communication together.
card.name: Team Communication Setup

card.desc:
# Consider

Before you start creating repositories ask yourself some questions and collect feedback from colleges.

## Location

Where to setup the repository?

- Client got one
- GitLab (allows to invite external developers)
- GitHub 

## Groups or Naming

Are there multiple Repositories? Then agree on a naming convention e.g. `<client_name>-frontend` or `<client_name>-backend` or `<client_name>-service-<service_name>`

**GitLab** provides groups where you can organise your work e.g.:

- Client
  - Project one
    - Repository one
    - Repository two
  - Project two
card.name: Repository Setup

card.desc: [Documentation](https://www.ibm.com/garage/method/practices/think/user-stories/)
card.name: Writing User Stories

card.desc: Here there are all goals we want to achieve in the MVP besides the MVP Statement, like learning something new, using a new open source technology or something else what would be nice to have.
card.name: Goals Column Description

card.desc:
Cards in this column show additional information like:
 - MVP statement
 - URLs for back and / or frontend
 - Links to repositories
 - Links to recordings and other external documents
 - Actors / Persona descriptions
 - Contact list and responsibilities 
 - Representatives in case of illness or holidays
card.name: Information Column Description

card.desc:
During the retrospective we also work on solutions to improve the quality of the upcoming iterations.
When we stumble over some negative or improvable things, we discuss a possible solution for that impediment and than we create an action item for that. 
This can be anything small from being on time for the daily stand-ups or something bigger like getting a new person on board to manage the workload.
card.name: Retrospective: Actions

card.desc:
In every project or week, there are things which didn't went that well. There are always bits and pieces which can be improved. Not them down here and always take care how you formulate something.
This should not be a place to blame someone. We're professionals, so lets start a fact based discussion which leads to a satisfying solution for everyone.
card.name: Retrospective: Improvable

card.desc: Everything neutral which is worth mentioning goes in here.
card.name: Retrospective: Neutral

card.desc:
Everything what was good in this iteration goes into this column.
It does not only refer to the current project. It also can be e.g. your local soccer team won an important game or anything else you are happy about.
card.name: Retrospective: Positive

old.desc:
Everything what was good in this iteration goes into this column.
It does not only refer to the current project. It also can be e.g. your local soccer team won an important game or anything else you are happy of.

card.desc:
Everything what was good in this iteration goes into this column.
It does not only refer to the current project. It also can be e.g. your local soccer team won an important game or anything else you are happy of.
card.name: Retrospective: Positive

old.desc:
Everything what was good in this iteration goes into this column.
It does not only refer to the current project. It also can be e.g. your local soccer team won a important game or anything else you are happy of.

card.desc:
Everything what was good in this iteration goes into this column.
It does not only refer to the current project. It also can be e.g. your local soccer team won a important game or anything else you are happy of.
card.name: Retrospective: Positive

card.desc: Stories, Tasks and Bugs which are completely done are located here and remain in reverse order in which they had been processed. That means, the card on the bottom was the first finished card.
card.name: Done Column Description

card.desc:
User stories which are deployed and reviewed by the developer are moved into awaiting acceptance. Here the owner of the project can double check the work and check the acceptance criteria the developer wrote.
Every card here has to be provided with acceptance criteria or a step by step guid to verify the work.
In some cases a small video or image is also sufficient.
card.name: Awaiting Acceptance Column Description

card.desc: User stories which are finished but not yet deployed are waiting here till they are deployed
card.name: Awaiting Deployment Column Description

card.desc:
Stories, tasks or other cards, which are currently in work are moved into this column. 
If you moved a card into this column, assign yourself to it, before start working on it. 
If the card is not finished, because of some missing dependencies or some technical impediments, move the card back to the backlog before starting on an other card.
Also leave a comment why there are impediments.
card.name: In Progress Column Description

card.desc:
The Backlog column holds stories, tasks, bugs and other cards which are in scope of the MVP.
The order of the cards in the backlog describes the priority. The card on top has the highest priority and gets processed next.
The order can be changed any time, but normally gets ordered in the beginning of an iteration in the planning meeting.
card.name: Backlog Column Description

card.desc:
The Icebox column contains user stories, task or other cards, which are worth mentioning but are not part or in the scope of the MVP.
Also in cases where time is short or priorities have changed, cards can be moved to the Icebox.
card.name: Icebox Column Description

card.desc: In this column are mitigations to overcome the defined risks.
card.name: Mitigation Column Description

old.name: Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like: - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries - Concerns about data integrity - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase - General failure safety

card.desc:
Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like:
 - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries
 - Concerns about data integrity
 - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase
 - General failure safety
card.name: Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like: - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries - Concerns about data integrity - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase - General failure safety

Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like: - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries - Concerns about data integrity - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase - General failure safety

old.name: Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like:  - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries  - Concerns about data integrity  - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase  - General failure safety

card.name: Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like:  - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries  - Concerns about data integrity  - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase  - General failure safety

cards.desc:
Cards in this column show additional information like:
 - MVP statement
 - URLs for back and / or frontend
 - Links to repositories
 - Links to recordings and other external documents
 - Actors / Persona descriptions
 - Contact list and responsibilities 
 - Representatives in case of illness or holidays
cards.name: Information Column Description

cards.desc: Here there are all goals we want to achieve in the MVP besides the MVP Statement, like learning something new, using a new open source technology or something else what would be nice to have.
cards.name: Goals Column Description

cards.desc:
Cards in this column explain and highlight risks like:
 - Technical issues e.g. outdated libraries
 - Concerns about data integrity
 - Risks when starting with untested or existing codebase
 - General failure safety
cards.name: Risk Column Description

cards.desc: In this column are mitigations to overcome the defined risks.
cards.name: Mitigation Column Description

cards.desc:
The Icebox column contains user stories, task or other cards, which are worth mentioning but are not part or in the scope of the MVP.
Also in cases where time is short or priorities have changed, cards can be moved to the Icebox.
cards.name: Icebox Column Description
